channel.title: Comments on: Six essential JavaScript libraries

item.title: By: Jonathan Fishbein
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Fishbein
item.description: I was tinkering with fetch today. The CORS support seems different than axios/jquery/xhr. I was Not able to fetch data from another domain when used in a chrome extension. Anyone have experience with this?
item.content:encoded: I was tinkering with fetch today. The CORS support seems different than axios/jquery/xhr. I was Not able to fetch data from another domain when used in a chrome extension. Anyone have experience with this?

item.title: By: evandrix
item.dc:creator: evandrix
item.content:encoded: There’s also `sugar` @ http://sugarjs.com/ that’s note-worthy!

item.title: By: evandrix
item.dc:creator: evandrix
item.description: Have you tried using Kefir with Redux instead of React?
item.content:encoded: Have you tried using Kefir with Redux instead of React?

item.title: By: Nikos
item.dc:creator: Nikos
item.description: Why not just use fetch instead of axios?
item.content:encoded: Why not just use fetch instead of axios?

item.title: By: Å ime Vidas
item.dc:creator: Å ime Vidas
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/six-essential-javascript-libraries/#comment-389">Jack</a>.
The Fetch API polyfill seems like the optimal solution: https://github.com/github/fetch (since itâ€™s the standard API meant to replace XHR)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jack.

The Fetch API polyfill seems like the optimal solution: https://github.com/github/fetch (since itâ€™s the standard API meant to replace XHR)

item.title: By: jamesknelson
item.dc:creator: jamesknelson
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/six-essential-javascript-libraries/#comment-389">Jack</a>.
I didn't actually know about it when I wrote the post, but it sounds like a great. I'm planning on trying it out myself in my next project.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jack.

I didn’t actually know about it when I wrote the post, but it sounds like a great. I’m planning on trying it out myself in my next project.

item.title: By: Jack
item.dc:creator: Jack
item.description: Do you have any thoughts on using a <a href='https://github.com/matthew-andrews/isomorphic-fetch' rel="nofollow">node compatible fetch library</a> instead of axios?
item.content:encoded: Do you have any thoughts on using a node compatible fetch library instead of axios?

item.title: By: Lucas Medina
item.dc:creator: Lucas Medina
item.description:
Those are some amazing libraries. I didn't know about Axios, it seems pretty neat to use it instead of those monster-sized libraries, like jQuery or Angular, at least when you don't actually need that much.
I knew about Moment.js, but since I'm kind of fresh in web development, I've never had the chance to use it. I'll keep those in mind :)
Thanks a lot! Nice posting!
item.content:encoded:
Those are some amazing libraries.
I didn’t know about Axios, it seems pretty neat to use it instead of those monster-sized libraries, like jQuery or Angular, at least when you don’t actually need that much.

I knew about Moment.js, but since I’m kind of fresh in web development, I’ve never had the chance to use it. I’ll keep those in mind ðŸ™‚

Thanks a lot!
Nice posting!

item.title: By: Jon Snow
item.dc:creator: Jon Snow
item.description: Have you looked at Reactive Extensions (https://github.com/Reactive-Extensions/RxJS)? If you liked Kefir, I think you might like RxJs too.
item.content:encoded: Have you looked at Reactive Extensions (https://github.com/Reactive-Extensions/RxJS)? If you liked Kefir, I think you might like RxJs too.
